intro: Berkheya decurrens, commonly known as the zigzag buckthorn, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 2–4 meters. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences, which bloom in late winter to early spring. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a zigzag or wavy margin, giving it its common name. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
